children.value: Earth System Data Lab Tutorial @ Euro Data Cube

children.label: Earth System Data Lab Tutorial @ Euro Data Cube

children.value: Brought to you by Brockmann Consult

children.label: Brought to you by Brockmann Consult

children.value: The Earth System Data Cube is a collection of pre-generated data cubes with geophysical, biogeochemical, and ecological variables relevant for Earth System Sciences. These data sets are open and free and thus also available also through EDC. This notebook demonstrates access to the ESDC data sets.
Due to memory problems with dask versions greater than 2021.03.1 as described in issue
it is necessary to use dask distributed client. We also import ‘progress’ to visualize the computing time.

children.value:
from xcube.core.store import new_data_store
import xarray as xr

# utilities
from ipywidgets import interact
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib
%matplotlib inline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')
warnings.simplefilter('ignore')

children.value:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = [14,5], ncols=1)
precip_3month.sel(lat=53,lon=7., method='nearest').plot(ax=ax, color = 'red')
precip_monthly_rechunked.sel(lat=53,lon=7., method='nearest').plot(ax=ax, color = 'blue')
For the following functions it is good to use the time optimized data cube again, that’s why ESDC_low_time_opt is used.

fig2, ax2 = plt.subplots(figsize = [12,5], ncols=2)

air_temp_sum.plot(ax = ax2[0])
ax2[0].set_title("No of obs above or below 2 sigma")

evap.plot(ax = ax2[1])
ax2[1].set_title("No of obs above or below 2 sigma")

plt.tight_layout()
